content:
hey, i've recently tried using rust-analyser while working on rustc again.

but deactivated it again for now because of two issues:

  • format on save: applies while working on clippy files as well and afaict can't only be enabled for specific subdirs? disabled that by itself
  • rust analyser uses ./x.py check which ends up locking the build directory for a noticeable amount of time, preventing my own uses of ./x.py from running. Can this be avoided? I wouldn't mind just having a separate directory used by r-a even if that needs a lot more storage

I would expect the first to be a bug (rustfmt.toml should be respected), but not sure.

For the second, if you can specify a manual config.toml for x.py, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/config.toml.example#L212 should work
